name: Black Olive Tapenade With Garlic, Capers, and Anchovies
description: This famed olive spread from Provence is made from black olives, capers, anchovies, herbs, and garlic.
totalTime: 10 minutes with food processor, 25 minutes with mortar and pestle
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup pitted black olives, such as Niçoise or oil-cured olives
1 tablespoon loosely packed fresh oregano, marjoram, or thyme leaves
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, if needed

recipeInstructions.text: If using a food processor: Combine olives, capers, anchovies, garlic, basil (if using), other herbs, and mustard in the work bowl and process, scraping down the sides, until a finely chopped paste forms. Process in lemon juice. With the processor running, drizzle in just enough olive oil to loosen to a spreadable paste, about 2 tablespoons. Season with salt and pepper only if needed.

If using a mortar and pestle: Roughly chop olives, capers, anchovies, and garlic, then add to mortar with basil (if using) and other herbs. Tap, crush, and smash with pestle until ingredients have been reduced to a thick paste (a little chunkiness is okay). Using pestle, work in mustard and lemon juice, then drizzle in just enough olive oil to form a spreadable paste, about 2 tablespoons. Season with salt and pepper only if needed.
